details.description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of The Bowl at Ballantyne, a captivating destination where culinary delights, enriching experiences, and natural beauty converge. Stroll along the picturesque stream park, savor delectable flavors at a diverse array of eateries, and indulge in pampering services that elevate your every day. Discover a world of endless possibilities at The Bowl, where every moment is crafted to inspire and delight.

reviews_data.review_text: We love Ballantyne Bowl. Easy to find nearby parking, great choice of places to eat, lots of green space. Great family atmosphere, too!
Good dine-in options... Ample Free parking for 3 hrs upon registration
Nice park for kids, they have a good time on the slides, also a great place for a nice walk with a loved one or just to get some solitude.
The parking situation needs reconsideration, but the family atmosphere the variety of shoppes and eatery options are top notch!!

Stream Park. OMB. Amphitheatre. Workout studio. Open space. So many places to eat including North Italia, Postino and Old Meck Brewery.  All of this space backs up to the Ballantyne Hotel which has amazing rooms, a spectacular spa and places to dine as well. The seating overlooking their ponds with fountains are so relaxing.

Parking can be tough especially on weekends and holidays. Car pool or Uber if possible.

This mixed used area is perfect in every way.
Wow! No follow up. Arrogant staff. Dismissive when asked about menu. And the beer is mediocre at best!
Great time with the kids surrounded by bars n restaurants

I had an absolutely fantastic experience at The Bowl at Ballantyne! The atmosphere is bright, clean, and welcoming, making it the perfect spot for a healthy meal. I was so impressed with the freshness and quality of the ingredients in my bowl – everything tasted vibrant and delicious. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, offering great recommendations from their extensive menu of bowls, smoothies, and toasts. It's a wonderful place to grab a quick, nutritious, and satisfying meal. I can't wait to come back and try something else!
New, contemporary outdoor mall with specialty shops and restaurants. We went to Harriet’s Hamburgers- tasty and fast!
Super bien, excelente servicio

This place was great when it first opened but now just not worth it with parking being such a hassle. I am not providing you my email and phone number so you can data mine. Greed is insane. Tenants of this place should realize the “new parking” system will hurt your business in the long run.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Sachin, thank you for your feedback. We understand changes like this can feel frustrating. The reason behind the parking program is to increase space turnover and ensure that parking is only being used by patrons of The Bowl. With that said, we’ve thoughtfully designed the new parking system to include free options and to make visiting as convenient as possible. The parking lots and retail garage are 3 hours free every visit in addition to free options with no time limit. We also want to clarify that the information requested for parking registration is used solely for parking purposes and is not shared or used for anything else. Our goal is always to create a great experience for everyone visiting The Bowl.

reviews_data.review_text: Great place for the little kids to burn out energy and grab a coffee on the weekends
This was my first visit to this site. Everyone was great. My only recommendation would be to add some navigation maps for pedestrians, similar to those you see is shopping malls and amusement parks.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi, thank you for your feedback and for visiting The Bowl. We do have some signage with maps of The Bowl placed near Postino and near the green. We also recommend visiting the map on our website prior to your next visit: https://thebowlnc.com/map

reviews_data.review_text: Beautiful place, restaurants and pubs.

As a temporarily handicapped person, the parking is abysmal. Not enough designated handicapped spaces in actual useful places.  If you are mobility challenged, have someone drop you off at restaurants.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Lynne, thank you for your feedback. We have passed this along to the management team. If you would like to reach out to info@thebowlnc.com, we would like to learn more about your experience and we can also provide a map of handicap parking spaces at The Bowl.

reviews_data.review_text: Nice place to grab a lite bite.. wasn't much going on but is also family friendly environment..
Great family ambiance. Sausages, beer and pretzels are the best in town

When this first opened, I'd of given it 5 stars. Now they have predatory parking attendants that are writing tickets 2 minutes after you park if you havent yet scanned the code. My wife parked in one of the street lots with a 15 minute limit and the attendant literally ran over and tried to write her a ticket right after she entered a restaurant for a togo order. They didnt even try to wait the 15 minutes or give any time to type in the information needed once she went inside. Then the guy yelled at her and called her entitled when she was in and out in under 5 minutes. The greed is insane and the hassel of dealing with people like this makes coming back way less desirable. While the idea is for more turnover, the fact of the matter is its nothing more than a money grubbing tactic based in greed over convenience.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Tyler, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're sorry to hear about your experience. While the parking attendants are there to help enforce the parking program, we have also trained them to educate guests about how it works and assist when needed. For future reference, the 15-minute spaces do not require registration. Please know we'll be reviewing this situation with our team. We would also like the chance to reach out to you directly if you'd like to send an email to info@thebowlnc.com with your wife's license plate number and the exact location of where she was parking so we can investigate further.

reviews_data.review_text: The restaurants moving into the Bowl are pretty good. I wouldn’t say they are most outstanding in the area. I enjoyed going there when it first opened up, but now with the pay for parking hassle (even with the “free time period”). Not worth the hassle - I won’t be returning and everyone I talk to seems to be expressing this same thing without me even bringing it up. It’s too bad. I thought this was going to be a fun addition to the area

reviews_data.review_text:
The Bowl now charges for parking so I won’t be going back.  Seems greedy for a suburban shopping center.
I'm not going to go to the trouble of scanning a QR code, logging in & sharing my CC number for a 30-60  minute meal or purchase, I stand by my original comments (regardless of management's reply) that parking should be completely free in a suburban shopping center,  there are too many great alternatives in Ballantyne, Blakeney, Redstone,  Stonecrest, Toringdon, Rea Farms, etc. with free parking and no stupid parking regulations.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Dennis, we understand changes like this can feel frustrating. The reasoning behind parking enforcement is to increase space turnover and ensure that parking is only being used by patrons of The Bowl. reviews_data.review_text:
I recently dined at your restaurant and wanted to share some feedback regarding the parking situation. While the food and service were excellent, I was surprised and disappointed to find that parking was not complimentary.

As a paying customer, I believe that parking should either be validated or included as a courtesy. Having to pay an additional fee to park—especially without prior notice—detracted from what was otherwise an enjoyable experience.

I hope you’ll consider addressing this issue, whether by offering validation or by making your parking policy more transparent on your website and during the reservation process.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

reviews_data.review_text: I think this is the perfect spot to visit in the evening—when the crowd dies down—to enjoy the quiet, the fountains, and the beautiful lighting. A little piece of Europe right near Charlotte.

We had an early dinner at Flower Child and then spent the evening hanging out outside while the kids ran around and played, it was such a great time. The Bowl at Ballantyne is the perfect spot for casual meetups with friends. There’s a relaxed, family-friendly vibe, and plenty of space for kids to be kids. Plus, with so many different options like coffee, gelato, and other restaurants nearby, it’s easy to please everyone. We love coming here!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi, thank you for your review and we are happy to hear you are enjoying The Bowl. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Not crazy about the new paid parking but,  I get it as the businesses should be able to get an influx of different customers being able to park and frequent their establishments.

Newly implemented paid parking when a lot of the establishments haven’t even opened. If your aim is truly to increase turnover and ensure space for patrons, give the existing establishments there the option to validate parking.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Sabreen, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We understand how important convenient parking is and appreciate you voicing your concerns. Currently, 92% of parking in and around The Bowl remains free for 2 hours or more, which we’ve found covers the majority of typical restaurant visits. Some Bowl restaurants do offer additional validation to their customers.

reviews_data.review_text: I used to leave in this area and move to lake Norman and time changed so much into beautiful developments. It is cozy with concert stadium, restaurants and beautiful luxury apartments, you can’t beat the vibes. It is absolutely fun
Nice place to hangout

When the restaurants first opened they were swamped by customers.  Finding a parking spot was the biggest challenge.  Either Northwood or Cooper Carry under estimated the needed parking spaces.  Today they charge to park at the bowl, in the street
in the lots or garage. We ate at Postino’s on July 6th and at 7 pm it wasn’t half full.  The staff said since parking was being charged business has tanked.  Shame on Northwood to punish their tenants for their mistake.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Tim, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We understand how important convenient parking is and appreciate you voicing your concerns. In developing our new parking program, we’ve worked closely with our businesses to ensure it supports both their needs and those of our guests. Currently, 92% of parking in and around The Bowl remains free for 2 hours or more, which we’ve found covers the majority of typical restaurant visits. That said, we’re actively monitoring the program’s impact and continuing to listen to feedback from our community and tenants as we explore ways to improve the overall experience.

reviews_data.review_text: The Bowl at Ballantyne is such a fun and vibrant place to visit! Right now, the flowers are in full bloom, adding gorgeous pops of color all around the walking paths. Families were out enjoying the weather, kids were playing on the green space, and people were relaxing with ice cream outside the gelato shop. The atmosphere is lively yet laid-back, with great dining options all around — from Flower Child and North Italia to The Salty and Honeysuckle Gelato. My favorite, though, was Rooster’s Wood-Fired Kitchen — absolutely delicious! It’s the perfect spot for a weekend stroll, casual dinner, or just soaking up the sunshine.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Aleksandra, thank you so much for sharing these great images. We're happy to hear you enjoyed your visit to The Bowl!

reviews_data.review_text: Love walking around her with my daughter. Cool park with play areas, good food, good drink. Now it's paid parking, but normally plenty of it.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Michael, thank you for your feedback! We are happy to hear you have been enjoying The Bowl with your family. Our surface lots and parking garage are 2 hours free upon registering your vehicle. In addition, street parking on Upper and Lower Avenue is always free with no time limit. We recommend those two options when coming to visit with the family!

reviews_data.review_text: I have been to the Ballantyne Bowl numerous times with coworkers for lunch, after work happy hours, and with friends. As of June 2025, you now have to pay for parking in the Ballantyne Bowl (and go through the bureaucracy of another app on your phone!). This is an unwelcome, absurd, and frustrating change that I hope is reversed soon.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Bob, the parking lots are 2 hours free every visit in addition to free options with no time limit. The reasoning behind parking enforcement is to increase space turnover and ensure that parking is only being used by patrons of The Bowl. You also do not have to download an app to register your vehicle. Our goal is always to create a great experience for everyone visiting The Bowl. You can view free parking options and durations here: https://thebowlnc.com/pages/parking.

reviews_data.review_text: Horrific parking. Honeysuckle Gelato way overpriced. $8 for two scoops. Too expensive and too far to drive for the aggravation. Once and done for me.

Loved the addition of the Bowl to Ballantyne which finally brought some decent restaurants to this area but the new pay to park policy is absurd. This is Ballantyne not Southend. If I have to pay to park I will continue driving to Southend where I have 10 times the options and it only costs $3 to park for two hours. Super disappointed in the Bowl. This is also going to take away from families who utilized the bowl as a full day activity where the only cost was lunch or a sweet treat.  This should really be rethought. Somewhere, someone in corporate got this one wrong.

reviews_data.review_text: Fantastic Place
Had a great experience, cool local spot.

Parking is easy, walking between places is nice, plenty of outdoor space, but the quality of food for the price at some of the restaurants is lacking. It’s close to the greenway as well. There’s a playground for kids and plenty of seating for adults and families alike. Enjoy views of the Ballantyne hotel from rocking chairs overlooking the fountain. There’s a lot to do and tons for your kiddo’s.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Stephanie, we appreciate your feedback and thank you for sharing these great pictures!

reviews_data.review_text: This is a nice place to go. It will be busy if there is a concert at the AMP.

Was great until they started charging for parking. We’re in the suburbs, for crying out loud. Before whomever is responding to these reviews hit me with a “thoughtful” copy and paste response, please note: my kids and I used to spend hours here every week, on weekdays. We’d start by mama getting a coffee, going to stream park to let the kids burn some energy, followed by lunch out. Walk around some more, then get ice cream and the kids will run around the green space outside honeysuckle afterwards. It was convenient to park right there. Yes, we can go park in the garage since we’ll be more than 2 hours, but it’s a farther walk and a heck of a lot more inconvenient for mothers like myself who are wrangling two small kids and everything that comes with them. We’ll go elsewhere now. So no, this wasn’t a “thoughtful” decision. You only thought of your greed and deepening your pockets, all at the expense of us consumers.

Watch this review be buried by a sudden onslaught of 5 star reviews probably from the bowl’s management employees or influencers who are getting paid to advertise the place.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Finn, thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We genuinely hear your concerns and understand how this change impacts families like yours who have made The Bowl part of their routine. Our goal in implementing the new parking system was to ensure parking remains available for all visitors by increasing space turnover, not to discourage time spent here. That said, we know it’s an adjustment, and we’re committed to finding ways to make the experience better. We’ll continue to share feedback like yours with our team, and if you'd like to talk more, you can always reach us directly at ballantyne@legacyparking.com.

reviews_data.review_text: Beautiful, nice and friendly.

Great area, but parking is a challenge.  They do offer the first 2 hours free.  You will need to scan a code on a sign and enter your license tag.  Signs may or may not be close to your car, so make sure you know your tag number.  Lots of great restaurant choices, outdoor spaces, and areas to play or relax.
Great location for family.

The Bowl was a fantastic place to eat and relax until they implemented this new parking. I don’t mind paying for parking in general as long as the transaction is seamless. The parking system at Optimist Hall is seamless — you drive in, pay if needed, drive out and don’t have to do anything else. Why, in 2025, are we using parking systems without clear instructions. I stopped for a quick lunch and realized 45 mins after I left that my parking session was still running. There was not any signage anywhere that stated how to end a parking session — so I assumed you just leave like all the other ones. Upon research, it looks like this parking system is meant and optimized for garages, not an open parking lot. Why in the app, does it say you have to scan to exit? But then there are no clear instructions at the exit of the parking lot at The Bowl about how to end your session. I actually drove back later that day to see if there was a QR code to scan upon exiting — but there was nothing. So, when I get charged for this parking session (I was there way less than 2 hours) I plan to dispute the charge. And I will not be returning to The Bowl any time soon. Is everyone else just getting charged without realizing? It’s crazy to me that the app and signage at The Bowl are not clear. Also, please don’t give me the copy paste response you have been giving everyone else complaining about parking. I would like an actual response explaining how to end your parking session when you actually leave.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Garreth, thank you for your valued feedback. We understand the confusion caused by the app wording regarding exiting. To clarify: there is no need to scan anything to end your parking session at The Bowl. It will automatically end once the duration you originally selected expires. We're currently working to update both the signage and the app messaging to more accurately reflect how the system works. Our goal is to make the parking experience as seamless and efficient as possible. We hope to welcome you back to The Bowl soon. If you have any further questions or need assistance, please don’t hesitate to reach out to ballantyne@legacyparking.com.

reviews_data.review_text: Was cool until they started to charge for parking. I will not go if I have to pay to park. That’s ridiculous. The Bowl will be the next Epicenter…empty.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Joanna, we hear you and completely understand this is a change. We’ve thoughtfully designed the new parking system to include free options and to make visiting as convenient as possible. The parking lots are 2 hours free every visit in addition to free options with no time limit. The reasoning behind parking enforcement is to increase space turnover and ensure that parking is only being used by patrons of The Bowl. Our goal is always to create a great experience for everyone visiting The Bowl. You can view free parking options and durations here: https://thebowlnc.com/pages/parking.

raw_data.description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of The Bowl at Ballantyne, a captivating destination where culinary delights, enriching experiences, and natural beauty converge. Stroll along the picturesque stream park, savor delectable flavors at a diverse array of eateries, and indulge in pampering services that elevate your every day. Discover a world of endless possibilities at The Bowl, where every moment is crafted to inspire and delight.
raw_data.typical_time_spent: People typically spend up to 1.5 hours here
raw_data.subtypes: Shopping mall, Event venue, Food court, Tourist attraction

reviews_data.review_text: We love Ballantyne Bowl. Easy to find nearby parking, great choice of places to eat, lots of green space. Great family atmosphere, too!
Good dine-in options... Ample Free parking for 3 hrs upon registration
Nice park for kids, they have a good time on the slides, also a great place for a nice walk with a loved one or just to get some solitude.
The parking situation needs reconsideration, but the family atmosphere the variety of shoppes and eatery options are top notch!!

Stream Park. OMB. Amphitheatre. Workout studio. Open space. So many places to eat including North Italia, Postino and Old Meck Brewery.  All of this space backs up to the Ballantyne Hotel which has amazing rooms, a spectacular spa and places to dine as well. The seating overlooking their ponds with fountains are so relaxing.

Parking can be tough especially on weekends and holidays. Car pool or Uber if possible.

This mixed used area is perfect in every way.
Wow! No follow up. Arrogant staff. Dismissive when asked about menu. And the beer is mediocre at best!
Great time with the kids surrounded by bars n restaurants

I had an absolutely fantastic experience at The Bowl at Ballantyne! The atmosphere is bright, clean, and welcoming, making it the perfect spot for a healthy meal. I was so impressed with the freshness and quality of the ingredients in my bowl – everything tasted vibrant and delicious. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, offering great recommendations from their extensive menu of bowls, smoothies, and toasts. It's a wonderful place to grab a quick, nutritious, and satisfying meal. I can't wait to come back and try something else!
New, contemporary outdoor mall with specialty shops and restaurants. We went to Harriet’s Hamburgers- tasty and fast!
Super bien, excelente servicio

This place was great when it first opened but now just not worth it with parking being such a hassle. I am not providing you my email and phone number so you can data mine. Greed is insane. Tenants of this place should realize the “new parking” system will hurt your business in the long run.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Sachin, thank you for your feedback. We understand changes like this can feel frustrating. The reason behind the parking program is to increase space turnover and ensure that parking is only being used by patrons of The Bowl. With that said, we’ve thoughtfully designed the new parking system to include free options and to make visiting as convenient as possible. The parking lots and retail garage are 3 hours free every visit in addition to free options with no time limit. We also want to clarify that the information requested for parking registration is used solely for parking purposes and is not shared or used for anything else. Our goal is always to create a great experience for everyone visiting The Bowl.

reviews_data.review_text: Great place for the little kids to burn out energy and grab a coffee on the weekends
This was my first visit to this site. Everyone was great. My only recommendation would be to add some navigation maps for pedestrians, similar to those you see is shopping malls and amusement parks.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi, thank you for your feedback and for visiting The Bowl. We do have some signage with maps of The Bowl placed near Postino and near the green. We also recommend visiting the map on our website prior to your next visit: https://thebowlnc.com/map

reviews_data.review_text: Beautiful place, restaurants and pubs.

As a temporarily handicapped person, the parking is abysmal. Not enough designated handicapped spaces in actual useful places.  If you are mobility challenged, have someone drop you off at restaurants.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Lynne, thank you for your feedback. We have passed this along to the management team. If you would like to reach out to info@thebowlnc.com, we would like to learn more about your experience and we can also provide a map of handicap parking spaces at The Bowl.

reviews_data.review_text: Nice place to grab a lite bite.. wasn't much going on but is also family friendly environment..
Great family ambiance. Sausages, beer and pretzels are the best in town

When this first opened, I'd of given it 5 stars. Now they have predatory parking attendants that are writing tickets 2 minutes after you park if you havent yet scanned the code. My wife parked in one of the street lots with a 15 minute limit and the attendant literally ran over and tried to write her a ticket right after she entered a restaurant for a togo order. They didnt even try to wait the 15 minutes or give any time to type in the information needed once she went inside. Then the guy yelled at her and called her entitled when she was in and out in under 5 minutes. The greed is insane and the hassel of dealing with people like this makes coming back way less desirable. While the idea is for more turnover, the fact of the matter is its nothing more than a money grubbing tactic based in greed over convenience.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Tyler, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're sorry to hear about your experience. While the parking attendants are there to help enforce the parking program, we have also trained them to educate guests about how it works and assist when needed. For future reference, the 15-minute spaces do not require registration. Please know we'll be reviewing this situation with our team. We would also like the chance to reach out to you directly if you'd like to send an email to info@thebowlnc.com with your wife's license plate number and the exact location of where she was parking so we can investigate further.

reviews_data.review_text:
The Bowl now charges for parking so I won’t be going back.  Seems greedy for a suburban shopping center.
I'm not going to go to the trouble of scanning a QR code, logging in & sharing my CC number for a 30-60  minute meal or purchase, I stand by my original comments (regardless of management's reply) that parking should be completely free in a suburban shopping center,  there are too many great alternatives in Ballantyne, Blakeney, Redstone,  Stonecrest, Toringdon, Rea Farms, etc. with free parking and no stupid parking regulations.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Dennis, we understand changes like this can feel frustrating. The reasoning behind parking enforcement is to increase space turnover and ensure that parking is only being used by patrons of The Bowl. reviews_data.review_text:
I recently dined at your restaurant and wanted to share some feedback regarding the parking situation. While the food and service were excellent, I was surprised and disappointed to find that parking was not complimentary.

As a paying customer, I believe that parking should either be validated or included as a courtesy. Having to pay an additional fee to park—especially without prior notice—detracted from what was otherwise an enjoyable experience.

I hope you’ll consider addressing this issue, whether by offering validation or by making your parking policy more transparent on your website and during the reservation process.

Thank you for your time and consideration.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi James, we understand changes like this can feel frustrating. The reasoning behind parking enforcement is to increase space turnover and ensure that parking is only being used by patrons of The Bowl. reviews_data.review_text: I think this is the perfect spot to visit in the evening—when the crowd dies down—to enjoy the quiet, the fountains, and the beautiful lighting. A little piece of Europe right near Charlotte.

We had an early dinner at Flower Child and then spent the evening hanging out outside while the kids ran around and played, it was such a great time. The Bowl at Ballantyne is the perfect spot for casual meetups with friends. There’s a relaxed, family-friendly vibe, and plenty of space for kids to be kids. Plus, with so many different options like coffee, gelato, and other restaurants nearby, it’s easy to please everyone. We love coming here!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi, thank you for your review and we are happy to hear you are enjoying The Bowl. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Not crazy about the new paid parking but,  I get it as the businesses should be able to get an influx of different customers being able to park and frequent their establishments.

Newly implemented paid parking when a lot of the establishments haven’t even opened. If your aim is truly to increase turnover and ensure space for patrons, give the existing establishments there the option to validate parking.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Sabreen, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We understand how important convenient parking is and appreciate you voicing your concerns. Currently, 92% of parking in and around The Bowl remains free for 2 hours or more, which we’ve found covers the majority of typical restaurant visits. Some Bowl restaurants do offer additional validation to their customers.

reviews_data.review_text: I used to leave in this area and move to lake Norman and time changed so much into beautiful developments. It is cozy with concert stadium, restaurants and beautiful luxury apartments, you can’t beat the vibes. It is absolutely fun
Nice place to hangout

When the restaurants first opened they were swamped by customers.  Finding a parking spot was the biggest challenge.  Either Northwood or Cooper Carry under estimated the needed parking spaces.  Today they charge to park at the bowl, in the street
in the lots or garage. We ate at Postino’s on July 6th and at 7 pm it wasn’t half full.  The staff said since parking was being charged business has tanked.  Shame on Northwood to punish their tenants for their mistake.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Tim, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We understand how important convenient parking is and appreciate you voicing your concerns. In developing our new parking program, we’ve worked closely with our businesses to ensure it supports both their needs and those of our guests. Currently, 92% of parking in and around The Bowl remains free for 2 hours or more, which we’ve found covers the majority of typical restaurant visits. That said, we’re actively monitoring the program’s impact and continuing to listen to feedback from our community and tenants as we explore ways to improve the overall experience.

reviews_data.review_text: The Bowl at Ballantyne is such a fun and vibrant place to visit! Right now, the flowers are in full bloom, adding gorgeous pops of color all around the walking paths. Families were out enjoying the weather, kids were playing on the green space, and people were relaxing with ice cream outside the gelato shop. The atmosphere is lively yet laid-back, with great dining options all around — from Flower Child and North Italia to The Salty and Honeysuckle Gelato. My favorite, though, was Rooster’s Wood-Fired Kitchen — absolutely delicious! It’s the perfect spot for a weekend stroll, casual dinner, or just soaking up the sunshine.

reviews_data.review_text: I have been to the Ballantyne Bowl numerous times with coworkers for lunch, after work happy hours, and with friends. This is an unwelcome, absurd, and frustrating change that I hope is reversed soon.

You can view free parking options and durations here: https://thebowlnc.com/pages/parking.

reviews_data.review_text: Horrific parking. Honeysuckle Gelato way overpriced. $8 for two scoops. Too expensive and too far to drive for the aggravation. Once and done for me.

Loved the addition of the Bowl to Ballantyne which finally brought some decent restaurants to this area but the new pay to park policy is absurd. This is Ballantyne not Southend. If I have to pay to park I will continue driving to Southend where I have 10 times the options and it only costs $3 to park for two hours. Super disappointed in the Bowl. This is also going to take away from families who utilized the bowl as a full day activity where the only cost was lunch or a sweet treat.  This should really be rethought. Somewhere, someone in corporate got this one wrong.

reviews_data.review_text: Fantastic Place
Had a great experience, cool local spot.

Parking is easy, walking between places is nice, plenty of outdoor space, but the quality of food for the price at some of the restaurants is lacking. It’s close to the greenway as well. There’s a playground for kids and plenty of seating for adults and families alike. Enjoy views of the Ballantyne hotel from rocking chairs overlooking the fountain. There’s a lot to do and tons for your kiddo’s.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Stephanie, we appreciate your feedback and thank you for sharing these great pictures!

reviews_data.review_text: This is a nice place to go. It will be busy if there is a concert at the AMP.

Was great until they started charging for parking. We’re in the suburbs, for crying out loud. Before whomever is responding to these reviews hit me with a “thoughtful” copy and paste response, please note: my kids and I used to spend hours here every week, on weekdays. We’d start by mama getting a coffee, going to stream park to let the kids burn some energy, followed by lunch out. Walk around some more, then get ice cream and the kids will run around the green space outside honeysuckle afterwards. It was convenient to park right there. Yes, we can go park in the garage since we’ll be more than 2 hours, but it’s a farther walk and a heck of a lot more inconvenient for mothers like myself who are wrangling two small kids and everything that comes with them. We’ll go elsewhere now. So no, this wasn’t a “thoughtful” decision. You only thought of your greed and deepening your pockets, all at the expense of us consumers.

Watch this review be buried by a sudden onslaught of 5 star reviews probably from the bowl’s management employees or influencers who are getting paid to advertise the place.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Finn, thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We genuinely hear your concerns and understand how this change impacts families like yours who have made The Bowl part of their routine. Our goal in implementing the new parking system was to ensure parking remains available for all visitors by increasing space turnover, not to discourage time spent here. That said, we know it’s an adjustment, and we’re committed to finding ways to make the experience better. We’ll continue to share feedback like yours with our team, and if you'd like to talk more, you can always reach us directly at ballantyne@legacyparking.com.

reviews_data.review_text: Beautiful, nice and friendly.

Great area, but parking is a challenge.  They do offer the first 2 hours free.  You will need to scan a code on a sign and enter your license tag.  Signs may or may not be close to your car, so make sure you know your tag number.  Lots of great restaurant choices, outdoor spaces, and areas to play or relax.
Great location for family.

The Bowl was a fantastic place to eat and relax until they implemented this new parking. I don’t mind paying for parking in general as long as the transaction is seamless. The parking system at Optimist Hall is seamless — you drive in, pay if needed, drive out and don’t have to do anything else. Why, in 2025, are we using parking systems without clear instructions. I stopped for a quick lunch and realized 45 mins after I left that my parking session was still running. There was not any signage anywhere that stated how to end a parking session — so I assumed you just leave like all the other ones. Upon research, it looks like this parking system is meant and optimized for garages, not an open parking lot. Why in the app, does it say you have to scan to exit? But then there are no clear instructions at the exit of the parking lot at The Bowl about how to end your session. I actually drove back later that day to see if there was a QR code to scan upon exiting — but there was nothing. So, when I get charged for this parking session (I was there way less than 2 hours) I plan to dispute the charge. And I will not be returning to The Bowl any time soon. Is everyone else just getting charged without realizing? It’s crazy to me that the app and signage at The Bowl are not clear. Also, please don’t give me the copy paste response you have been giving everyone else complaining about parking. I would like an actual response explaining how to end your parking session when you actually leave.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Hi Garreth, thank you for your valued feedback. We understand the confusion caused by the app wording regarding exiting. To clarify: there is no need to scan anything to end your parking session at The Bowl. It will automatically end once the duration you originally selected expires. We're currently working to update both the signage and the app messaging to more accurately reflect how the system works. Our goal is to make the parking experience as seamless and efficient as possible. We hope to welcome you back to The Bowl soon. If you have any further questions or need assistance, please don’t hesitate to reach out to ballantyne@legacyparking.com.

The reasoning behind parking enforcement is to increase space turnover and ensure that parking is only being used by patrons of The Bowl.
